text: Since it’s JS, it’s using the loaded tracking code on a particular page, so there’s no need to pass portal id, it will fire a request based on the portal of the loaded tracking code

If you want to see what happens, just watch the network tab of the dev tools as you fire that JS. If you inspect the request, you’ll see the portal id in the params of the request to `<http://track.HubSpot.com|track.HubSpot.com>`
